channel.title: T-1 Lines on 0x000216
channel.description: Recent content in T-1 Lines on 0x000216

item.title: 2x2 Ethernet Takes on T-1
item.description: For the past decade, small and medium businesses have relied on T1 lines as their primary commercial telecom solution. However, a new competitor called 2x2 Ethernet, recently introduced by major nationwide carrier MegaPath, is emerging to challenge the long-standing T1. Let’s explore what 2x2 Ethernet offers. It might seem surprising that T1 lines would face competition, considering their 50-year history and widespread adoption. As the first widely available broadband digital connection for businesses, T1 emerged from telephone company research.

item.title: What Is The Real T1 Line Speed?
item.description: A T1 line is often described as a 1.5 Mbps dedicated bandwidth connection, but it’s actually a bit more nuanced than that. The true speed is 1.544 Mbps, with a usable payload of 1.536 Mbps. The reason for this difference lies in the T1 line’s structure and history. Developed by Bell Labs for telephone companies in the 1950s, T1 lines aimed to improve upon the limitations of analog systems. While utilizing existing copper wiring, T1 lines transmit digital signals, unlike the analog signals used in older phone systems.
